decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to use various cards to quickly assemble the Dark Depths combo, which involves getting both Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage on the battlefield to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. This deck utilizes cards like Sylvan Scrying, Expedition Map, Crop Rotation, and Vampire Hexmage to search for and assemble the combo pieces efficiently. It also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and Pithing Needle to protect the combo from disruption from the opponent. The deck aims to win the game quickly by creating a powerful Marit Lage token.

The main strategy of this Legacy Merfolk deck revolves around quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Master of the Pearl Trident, Lord of Atlantis, and True-Name Nemesis using Aether Vial and Chalice of the Void for disruption. The deck also includes a suite of counter spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With efficient creatures, disruptive spells, and lands like Cavern of Souls and Mutavault to support the tribe, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and resilient aggro strategy.

The main concept of this UWx control deck is to control the game with a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Search for Azcanta. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions, such as Entreat the Angels and Snapcaster Mage. It also utilizes the powerful synergy between Terminus and Counterbalance to control the board and ensure the opponent has a hard time establishing a board presence. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminus, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage through cards like Predict, Brainstorm, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The deck also seeks to control the top of the opponent's library with Counterbalance, while using Entreat the Angels as a finisher. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around controlling the game and outvaluing the opponent.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize, Hymn to Tourach, and Force of Will, while also maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Leovold, Emissary of Trest, and Deathrite Shaman. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Kolaghan's Command, Fatal Push, and Abrupt Decay to deal with threats. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent in the long game with card advantage from Brainstorm and powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, the Last Hope and Jace, the Mind Sculptor.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through powerful control spells and versatile creatures. It combines removal, hand disruption, and counterspells to handle threats while leveraging cards like Snapcaster Mage and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to maximize value. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Liliana, the Last Hope to control the battlefield and grind out incremental advantages. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence with efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, Gurmag Angler, and True-Name Nemesis. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also utilizing disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes versatile removal like Lightning Bolt and Deathrite Shaman, along with card selection and manipulation through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. Overall, the deck focuses on applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the game.

This deck aims to control the game through the strategic use of lands and various spells. Key cards like Dark Depths, Maze of Ith, and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale help disrupt opponent's strategies while keeping the board in check. Life from the Loam and Gamble provide card advantage, while Punishing Fire and Mox Diamond add versatility to the deck. With strong mana acceleration and land manipulation, this deck seeks to outlast opponents and gradually gain control of the game through incremental advantages.

This deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into the graveyard and then bringing them back into play with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. By utilizing cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, the deck can efficiently fill the graveyard with key creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Chancellor of the Annex and Thoughtseize to slow down the opponent's game plan. With the ability to quickly dump and reanimate creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a few turns.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll, Stinkweed Imp, and Faithless Looting, then utilize cards like Narcomoeba and Ichorid to generate creatures from the graveyard. Cabal Therapy is used to disrupt opponents and Bridge from Below helps generate tokens. Lion's Eye Diamond is key for fast mana generation. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with a never-ending stream of creatures from the graveyard while maintaining a strong board presence.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting opponents with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing mana acceleration with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with threats that are difficult to deal with efficiently. The inclusion of utility lands like Eye of Ugin and Karakas provide additional advantages in certain matchups, while cards like Umezawa's Jitte and Walking Ballista offer ways to close out games or deal with problematic creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between the various Elf creatures and spell cards to generate large amounts of mana quickly, allowing for explosive plays such as casting Craterhoof Behemoth. Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order are key cards in tutoring for the necessary pieces, while Glimpse of Nature provides card draw to keep the engine going. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of Elves and powerful creatures, aiming to win the game in a single turn through a big attack.

The key concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to maintain tempo and disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing a combination of cheap, efficient spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Stifle. The deck focuses on early aggression with creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer, backed up by burn spells like Lightning Bolt. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Gitaxian Probe to ensure consistency. Additionally, the inclusion of disruptive land destruction with Wasteland further controls the pace of the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently generate enough storm count to win the game in one turn. By using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond, Lotus Petal, and Rite of Flame, the player can build up their mana and spells to cast a powerful spell like Ad Nauseam or Empty the Warrens. The deck also includes a variety of cantrips and card draw spells to help dig for combo pieces, as well as disruption like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive storm count and win the game in a single turn.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while also setting up powerful late-game win conditions such as Terminus and Entreat the Angels. The deck utilizes card draw and manipulation like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key cards, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for additional card advantage. Additionally, utilizing Search for Azcanta and Counterbalance helps to control the board and maintain a dominant position in the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes powerful sideboard cards like Rest in Peace and Helm of Obedience to shut down graveyard-based strategies. The deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Engineered Explosives, while utilizing card draw and selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The mana base is structured to have access to all necessary colors while also minimizing vulnerability to non-basic land hate.
